awd_titl_txt: RUI:  Acquisition of an FT-NMR Spectrometer
awd_abstract_narration: This is a proposal to obtain a 300 MHz nuclear magnetic                         resonance spectrometer equipped with variable temperature                       1H/13C probe and a variable temperature controller.  The                        instrument will serve as a major research tool by members of the                chemistry department in the following areas:                                                                                                                    1.  isolation, structure proof and synthesis of biologically                        significant natural products.                                               2.  NMR studies of calmodulin - peptide interactions                            3.  thermodynamic study of the hydrophobic interaction                                                                                                          These research efforts require high sensitivity and resolution                  plus variable temperature control.  Acquisition of this                         instrument is expected to have a dramatic, positive effect on the               research efforts of the Department.  The utilization of the                     instrument will involve 5-10 undergraduates a year in senior                    research and similar number in summer research.
